answerText: "September 1, 1939"[10] "September 1, 1939" was written by this Anglo-American poet, who noted that "everything turns away quite leisurely from the disaster," in reference to a painting by Pieter Brueghel, in his "MuseÃÅe de Beaux Arts."
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Haverford and Michigan State B | 8 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: "Waves of anger and fear circulate over the bright and darkened lands of the earth" in this poem, whose author claims that "defenceless under the night our world in stupor lies." For 10 points each: [10] Luther, Thucydides, and "the Collective Man" all make appearances in what poem, whose title matches the date on which World War II began?
